mckay.utilities.webservices

Class ProxyServerAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • mckay.utilities.webservices.ProxyServerAccessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class ProxyServerAccessor
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Provides functionality for configuring web access via a proxy server. First checks to see if web access is enabled, and does nothing more if it is. If web access is not enabled, then checks a settings file to see if proxy server setting presets are available, and configures proxy access using them if they are. If such a settings file is not present or does not contain valid settings, then the user is presented with a dialog box allowing them to enter these settings and, if desired, save them to a settings file so they do not need to be entered again. Either way, proxy server access is then configured. Proxy settings files are saved so that only the user has read or write access, and they are encrypted.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProxyServerAccessor

        public ProxyServerAccessor(java.lang.String settings_save_path,
                   java.lang.String test_url)
        Check if web access is possible. If so, do nothing more. If not, check if a valid proxy settings file is available at the specified path. If so, parse the settings file and use it to configure the proxy server. If not, construct the GUI so that settings can be entered and potentially saved. An error dialog box is shown if any problems occur.
        Parameters:
        settings_save_path - The path of the proxy configuration file to be parsed or saved. Defaulted to "|user_home|/|user_name|_proxy_settings.cfg" if null. This file will be generated and parsed by objects of this class, and is optional.
        test_url - A URL to use to test if web access is available. Defaulted to "http://www.google.com" if null.

    • Method Detail

      • isURLAccessible

        public static boolean isURLAccessible(java.lang.String test_url,
                      java.lang.Exception[] exception_store)
        Tests to see if the given URL can be accessed.
        Parameters:
        test_url - The URL to use for testing web access. Note that the protocol must be specified. Example: "http://www.google.com".
        exception_store - An array of size 1. If an Exception is thrown during testing, then the first entry of this array will be set to this exception. If null is passed here, or if the passed array has a size other than 1, then it is ignored.
        Returns:
        True if the URL could be succesfully accessed, false otherwise.

      • accessWebViaProxyServer

        public static void accessWebViaProxyServer(java.lang.String proxy_server,
                           java.lang.String port,
                           java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String password)
        Enables http web access through a proxy server. This method only needs to be called once, and all http web access from then on in the current instantiation of the JRE will function without any further interaction.
        Parameters:
        proxy_server - The network address of the proxy server (e.g. "wwwcache.cs.waikato.ac.nz").
        port - The port used with the proxy server (e.g. "80").
        username - The username needed to access the proxy server. If this is not required, then "" should be passed.
        password - The password needed to access the proxy server. If this is not required, then "" should be passed.
